alert.note: Alert for Vanderburgh (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 1:39PM EST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Indiana and western Kentucky, including the following areas, in southwest Indiana, Vanderburgh. In western Kentucky, Henderson. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 PM CST, the public reported street flooding in Evansville at Bellemeade Ave. and Vann Ave. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Henderson, Newburgh, Melody Hill and Kasson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
